summary: "Heat" is a 1995 crime movie directed by Michael Mann, starring Al Pacino and Robert De Niro. It tells the story of an LAPD detective and a thief who are at odds, showing how this affects their work and personal lives. Mann based the script on a real-life chase between a Chicago police officer and a criminal. The film was a hit, making over $187 million. It's known for its powerful performances and is considered very influential. A sequel is in the works.
title: Heat (1995 film)
